result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan L Wittchow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: With Huber and Good Time Credit. The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amended Motion to Revoke Work Release Privideges and/or Forfeiture of Good Time Credit.

11:20 am case called. Defendant Nathan L Wittchow in court, in custody, appears via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over motion filed to revoke Huber and Good Time credit. Court questions defendant regarding violations and his position. Statement by defendant. Court finds the substinative components of motion is not being contested and have been violated. Court questions defendant regarding contesting revocation of Huber and Good Time. Defendant contests request to revoke Huber and GT. Statement by defendant. Court makes statement and enters an order suspending the defendant's Huber for the remainder of his sentence and also revokes entitlement of Good Time Credit-19 days. (After court-clerk noticed Motion brought in wrong action-amended motion and order provided in 14CF163)

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Inmate Request Form to the Court - Requesting a huber transfer to another facility - the Court orders an amendment of the JOC to reflect no objection to a huber transfer

4:02 pm cases called. 14CF163 & 16CF123. Defendant Nathan L Wittchow in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Defendant Nathan L Wittchow in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Revocation order and Warrant received-no material corrections or additions by either counsel. 16CF123-  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 2 & Count 3.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1 and dismisses the repeater enhancers on Counts 2 & 3. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Belville. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 14CF163- 8 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 56 days served. To begin immediately. Costs previously paid. 16CF123- SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS- The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through, DAAP, Contact with victim is at the discretion of the supervising agent.  Terms of Agent, Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: 3:15 pm case called. Defendant Nathan L Wittchow in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record. Court addresses preliminary hearing and waiver. Defendant wished to waive the right to a preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing-read the complaint, probable cause found, and enters an order binding over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading. Defendant enters a plea of No Contest.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: 15 days WCJ, with Huber-No Good Time Credit. No Credit for time served. To be served no later than June 15, 2015. AODA and follow through, maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
